snippet: The titans of the global aerospace industry converge Monday at the Farnborough Airshow. Frenetic buying by airlines the past two years has kept Airbus and Boeing busy, but short-term prospects are dimmer.
abstract: Short-term prospects for the aerospace industry appear grim as industry leaders prepare to meet at the Farnborough International Airshow in Hampshire, England; analysts expect industry orders to decline as the United States and Europe cut military spending amid deficit pressure.
lead_paragraph: The titans of the global aerospace industry converge Monday at the Farnborough Airshow. Frenetic buying by airlines the past two years has kept Airbus and Boeing busy, but short-term prospects are dimmer.

headline.main: Sales Activity at Air Show Expected to Be Subdued
headline.print_headline: Fewer Aircraft Orders Expected at Show This Year
